Empires & Puzzles Moonbell Hero Review & Strategy Guide

Is Moonbell still a star in the Empires & Puzzles universe? This review breaks down her unique mana-generating minions, massive damage reduction, and whether she holds up against the latest wave of power creep.
Moonbell Hero Review: The Astral Elf Summoner
Moonbell, The Astral Conductor: Infinite Mana and Minion Shields

Moonbell is a 5-star Holy hero from the Astral Elves family, originally released in July 2024. As a Sorcerer, she fits squarely into the support archetype, bringing a kit loaded with survivability and utility. She essentially functions as a battery for your team, keeping allies protected behind beefy minions while accelerating their mana generation to ridiculous levels.

While she doesn't directly heal damage already taken, her damage reduction and minion HP act as a massive buffer against incoming attacks. She represents a time when average speed heroes could still dictate the flow of battle through sheer utility rather than brute force. No costume is available for her at this time, so this review focuses entirely on her base form. If you like heroes that make your team feel immortal while they charge their skills at light speed, Moonbell is your elf.

The artwork for Moonbell leans heavily into the "Astral" theme—celestial, glowing, and slightly otherworldly. There is a distinct playfulness in her expression, contrasting with the stoic nature of many other elves. The color palette is a mix of deep cosmic blues and bright golds, fitting her Holy alignment. It is worth noting that the character design sparked some debate in the community regarding its androgynous features, which fits the ethereal, non-human nature of the Astral Elves perfectly. She looks like she is about to juggle planets, which, considering her special skill, is not too far off.
When we look at Moonbell's stats in the context of late 2025, the effects of power creep are undeniable.
Compared to modern behemoths like Devyani (1233 Power), Moonbell sits significantly lower.
This is quite low by modern standards, where attackers often breach 1300. Fortunately, her primary role isn't dealing direct damage.
Still respectable. It allows her to survive long enough to fire, though she is no longer the fortress she might have been upon release.
This is the most glaring weakness. Modern tanks and supports are pushing 2200+ HP. Since her minions inherit HP from her, this lower base health directly impacts the beefiness of her summons.
She falls into the "average" category for stats today—serviceable, but she needs Limit Breaking and emblems to survive against the latest damage dealers.
This skill is a Swiss Army knife of defensive utility.
These are not your average minions. Inheriting 35% HP is substantial. Even with her lower base health, these minions act as a significant meat shield.

This is the crown jewel. +33% mana generation for as long as the minion lives is huge. It transforms average speed heroes into fast ones and fast heroes into machine guns. Because it is tied to the minion, it is undispellable, which is a nightmare for dispellers to deal with.
-43% damage reduction for all allies is elite mitigation. It is comparable to classic heavyweights like Sif, but applies to the whole team.
The extra damage against boosted health is a nice cherry on top, specifically countering the overheal meta that dominates many defenses.
Let's break down the mechanics to see what Moonbell really brings to the table.
This effectively drops the tile requirement for an Average speed hero from 10 tiles to about 7.5 tiles (depending on troops), effectively making your team Fast/Very Fast once the engine is running.
With 5-star Troops (+15-20% HP): The minion HP can easily push past 900-1000. While not the "2000 HP" myth some players discussed, it is a very thick shield that must be chewed through.
With the 43% damage reduction, that ~800 HP minion effectively requires over 1400 damage to destroy. This makes the mana buff extremely sticky and hard to remove without specific minion counters.
Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Astral Elves kit is designed to punish enemies who rely on special skills and status effects.

The Astral Elf family bonus is generally about dispelling or cleansing, often triggered by minions or specific conditions. Having a chance to dispel or cleanse just by playing the game is a strong passive advantage that disrupts enemy rhythm.

Moonbell shares 20% of received damage with allies. This is a double-edged sword. It helps her survive snipes that would otherwise kill her, spreading the pain across her beefy minions. However, it can also soften up her teammates if she takes a heavy hit. In a minion-heavy team, this is mostly a positive as the minions absorb the shared damage.
A nice situational immunity, helpful against classic DoT heroes, but not a game-changer.

This is an excellent Aether Power for a support hero. Dodging special skills keeps her alive to cast her minions, which is her entire purpose. It adds another layer of RNG frustration for the attacker.

Upon release, Moonbell was seen as a versatile support. The shift from Slow in beta to Average in live made her instantly viable. She was a strong answer to heavy AoE damage dealers due to her damage reduction and a great accelerator for offense.

Her stats have aged. The raw numbers on her minions are lower than they would be on a hero released today with 2400 base HP. However, the mechanics—specifically the undispellable mana gen tied to minions—remain unique and powerful. Percentage-based damage reduction (-43%) also scales infinitely; it is just as effective against a hit for 500 damage as it is against a hit for 2000 damage.

, particularly in War Attack and Rush Tournaments. She is no longer a top-tier tank due to lower stats and the prevalence of minion counters (like Grimsteel or heroes with "destroy minion" passives). However, on offense, she allows you to shift gears and outpace the enemy team. She is a "force multiplier"—she makes your strong heroes stronger and faster.
As a Sorcerer, Moonbell needs survivability above all else. She does no direct damage with her skill, so Attack stats are largely wasted on her unless you are chasing tile damage.
Maximizes the HP of her minions, making the mana buff harder to remove. Increases her own survivability to ensure she fires.
Higher defense stat makes the shared damage passive slightly more efficient for her personal survival.
Minions are slightly smaller than the Health route.
path is the way to go. The synergy between her max HP and her minion HP is the core of her kit.
The +33% mana generation is massive and undispellable as long as the minion holds.
-43% damage reduction protects the whole team from massive hits.
Thick minions protect allies from status ailments and direct damage.
Useful against Overheal teams due to her damage bonus condition.
Heroes who destroy minions (e.g., Grimsteel, Ogima, various Lunar New Year heroes) instantly remove her mana buff and protection.
Her 2024 stats leave her vulnerable to being one-shot by modern 2025 snipers before she can fire.
If she cannot keep her minions on the board, she loses half her utility.
excellent. The damage reduction and minions keep the team alive through long waves, and the mana gen speeds up farming.
Very strong. She provides a safety net and helps charge your killers faster.
At Very Fast speed, she becomes oppressive, getting her protection up immediately.
She provides minions (which count as a buff for some mechanics) and damage reduction.
Moonbell shines when paired with heroes who benefit from speed or who can protect her minions.
Healers who boost health layer on top of Moonbell's minions. The mana gen from Moonbell helps the healers fire, and the boosted health ensures the minions aren't the only layer of defense.

Pairing her with other minion summoners (especially those that buff minions) creates a wall of HP that is exhausting to break through. Queen Guowang adds counterattack, punishing enemies for hitting the minions.
Stacking mana generation buffs. If Moonbell fires, and then a mana booster fires, your team basically never stops casting specials.
Anyone who deals extra damage to minions or destroys them before hitting renders Moonbell useless.
While the mana gen is undispellable (tied to minion), the damage reduction can be dispelled by heroes like Guardian Panther or other standard dispellers.
Heroes with passives that deal damage when minions are summoned or hit.

If you are lucky enough to pull Moonbell early, she will carry you through almost all map stages. Prioritize her leveling. Her damage reduction will allow your under-leveled 4-star heroes to survive hits from 5-star bosses. Don't worry about her attack stat; just keep her alive.

Moonbell is a niche pick for your roster depth. She is excellent for War depth, particularly against teams that rely on heavy initial burst damage but lack minion removal. Is she worth Alpha Aethers? Probably not, unless you use her on your primary war defense. There are better modern supports for that resource. However, she is definitely worth keeping and leveling for events and specific raid counters.
The community reaction to Moonbell was generally positive, especially regarding her shift from Slow to Average speed.
Players noted, "The endless +33% mana alone is worth the level for offense."
There was confusion regarding minion HP, with some believing in a "2000 HP minion" myth, which was debunked as requiring extreme troop and limit break investment.
regarding damage reduction stacking, with the consensus being she is a more versatile, defensive version.
One player perfectly summarized her utility: "When the others are asleep and she gets hit, boom all wake."

Moonbell is a relic of a slightly slower era, but her mechanics allow her to punch up effectively. She is the ultimate safety blanket for your team—wrapping them in a warm, damage-reducing fuzzy layer that also pumps them full of energy. While she won't one-shot anyone, she makes sure your other heroes survive long enough to do so. She is a solid, reliable A-tier support hero that brings immense utility to any roster that lacks modern premium supports.
A fantastic utility hero who has aged gracefully thanks to percentage-based skills, even if her raw stats are starting to show some wrinkles.
